oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DeWitt Community Library Trustees, 1962.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From left to right: The newly elected officers of the DeWitt Community Library are Edward K. Beemer, president; Theodore F. Calver, trustee; Mrs. Norman R. Roth, recording secretary; and Betty Smingler, trustee. Not pictured: George G. Heine, vice president.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Naming of the Buckland Community Room
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jack Abramson and Mrs. Jack Buckland hold up a plaque in honor of Jack Buckland. This presentation marks the renaming of the DeWitt Community Library's community room as the Buckland Community Room. The photo is incorrectly dated on the back as April 8, 1983. A Kodak print mark correctly indicates the year 1973.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hy Miller Speaking at DeWitt Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: New York State Assemblyman Hy Miller speaks at the DeWitt Community Library in April 1973. Miller initially represented the 119th and later the 121st Assembly District; he served as an assemblyman from 1970 - 1988. From a collection of photos taken at the DeWitt Community Library's 10th Anniversary celebration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Unknown;
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Libraries; Politicians;

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Looking at Historic Images of DeWitt, NY
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured from left to right: Robert Waters and Burton Lowitz. Lowitz would later run for Town of DeWitt Supervisor, serving six two-year terms from 1979 - 1991. The photos on the wall, part of Mr. Waters' collection, are of the old Manlius trolley. Visible text on the first image (at left) reads: "On road to Fayetteville from DeWitt via Onondaga County Club." From a collection of photos taken at the DeWitt Community Library's 10th Anniversary celebration.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Unknown;
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Libraries;

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rev. Carmichel Speaking at DeWitt Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rev. Alexander Carmichel of DeWitt Community Church speaking at the DeWitt Community Library. Seated behind him (and partially obscured by the microphone) is Marion Hall, Onondaga County Public Library trustee. Carmichel served as pastor of the DeWitt Community Church for 42 years. From a collection of photos taken at the DeWitt Community Library's 10th Anniversary celebration.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured here is the DeWitt Community Library's first ever public computer. As indicated by the sign, this Apple II computer was a "birthday gift from the DeWitt Rotary and Omnifax Computers."
